text: James Chaplin Higgins (December 25, 1918 – February 12, 2002) was an American professional basketball player. He played in the National Basketball League for the Hammond Ciesar All-Americans in one game during the 1940–41 season and scored one point. Higgins was also a minor league baseball player. He played for the Baltimore Orioles (minor league team), Federalsburg A's, Dover Orioles, Appleton Papermakers, and Vicksburg Hill Billies. == References == Category:1918 births Category:2002 deaths Category:American men's basketball players Category:Appleton Papermakers players Category:Baltimore Orioles (IL) players Category:Baseball players from Illinois Category:Basketball players from Illinois Category:Centers (basketball) Category:Dover Orioles players Category:Federalsburg A's players Category:Hammond Ciesar All-Americans players Category:People from Olney, Illinois Category:Vicksburg Hill Billies players
title: Jim Higgins (basketball)
